PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instruction: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Board, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask., where it will be preserved as part of the Provincial records of our Province.

Name: Robert James Halls
Address: 181, Leney

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1906
Where did you set up housekeeping? Toronto
Where had you been living before that? England
For how many people did you prepare meals? 4
How far was it to your nearest store? 60 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Once a month
That groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Groceries

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? All American
In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lbs.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $0.50
How much did you use graham flour? Not at all
Whole wheat flour? All American
Was flour milled locally? No
How far away? 60 miles
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? $0.30
What other grain products did you use? Wheat Flour
Oatmeal? Whole Wheat
Other? Rolled Oats
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No
How did you grind it?
